comment._content:
I always thought he was older than that.
everyone called him titus.
He had frostbitten feet and knew he was holding them all up. he walked out out in the middle of a raging blizzard. saying " I am just going outside and may be some time"> the whole story is full of heroism.
a good book on the whole thing is " the worst journey in the world" by Cherry_Garrard.

comment.author: 97947642@N00
comment._content: The Oates family lived at Gestingthorpe Hall in Essex, England. There is a memorial to A Very Gallant Gentleman in Gestingthorpe church. Oates's father and uncle were also explorers who died on expeditions. They also have memorials there. Captain Oates, and his female equivalent Nurse Edith Cavell, became role models for several generations of English people. Even when I was growing up in the 1960s, half a century after both their deaths, they were still held up in school as perfect examples of what English people should be - self-sacrificing, honourable, and quietly heroic. Part of Oates' fame can be explained by the fact that it occured in the early days of tabloid newspapers and mass newspaper readership. Scott's expedition was followed avidly by millions of readers, as no expedition had been before. They were among the first mass celebrities.

comment.author: 14183419@N02
comment._content:
